title: Afshin Peyrovani
text:
Mohammad Ali "Afshin" Peyrovani (, born 6 February 1970 in <a href="Shiraz%2C%20Iran">Shiraz, Iran</a>) is a retired <a href="Iran">Iran</a>ian <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> and a <a href="association%20football">football</a> coach. He is the younger brother of <a href="Gholam%20Peyrovani">Gholam Peyrovani</a> and <a href="Amir%20Hossein%20Peyrovani">Amir Hossein Peyrovani</a>. He is a Football Director at <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Perspolis</a> and a former player. A versatile player, he played in several positions throughout his career, including as a <a href="central%20defender">central defender</a> and <a href="right%20defender">right defender</a>. Throughout his club career, he played for <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Perspolis</a> and <a href="Paykan%20F.C.">Peykan</a> and won Iran league for Fifth time. Following his retirement, he also served as a manager for Perspolis.
A former <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran national</a>, he played in the <a href="1998%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1998 World Cup</a>, as well as the team that finished third In the <a href="1996%20AFC%20Asian%20Cup">1996 Asian Cup</a>.
Playing career.
Club career.
Peyrovani was a product of the <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a> youth academy. On 1 August 1993 he was signed by the first team where he spent 10 years of his playing career making over 200 appearances. On 29 August 2004 he moved to <a href="Paykan%20Tehran%20F.C.">Paykan Tehran F.C.</a> on a one-year deal. Peyrovani ended his career at the end of the <a href="2004%E2%80%9305%20Iran%20Premier%20League">IPL 2004/05</a> season.
International career.
He has 66 <a href="cap%20%28sport%29">caps</a> for the <a href="Iran%20national%20football%20team">Iran national football team</a> and was a participant at the <a href="1998%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1998 FIFA World Cup</a>.
Coaching career.
After the departure of <a href="Afshin%20Ghotbi">Afshin Ghotbi</a> in November 2008 he was appointed as the head coach of <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis F.C.</a> and was replaced and became the assistant coach of <a href="Nelo%20Vingada">Nelo Vingada</a> in mid February 2009 and a month later he was sacked totally by the chairman.
He replaced <a href="Hamid%20Estili">Hamid Estili</a> as the head coach of <a href="Steel%20Azin">Steel Azin</a> on 19 April 2010 and later on for the season after he was again appointed as the head coach of the team again which after poor results he resigned. On 6 November 2012, he was appointed as head coach of <a href="Azadegan%20League">Azadegan League</a> side <a href="Sang%20Ahan%20Bafq%20F.C.">Sang Ahan Bafq</a>.
Director career.
Iran National Football Team.
In September 2015, Peyrovani was appointed as director of Tean national football team. He was included in <a href="Carlos%20Queiroz">Carlos Queiroz</a> staff for 2018 World Cup Qualifying Asia. After a while, he tendered his resignation as sporting director and left the Iran football team. In 2018 , the disciplinary committee of the Iranian Football Federation suspended Peyrovani from all football activities for a period of five years due to financial irregularities.
Perspolis.
Peyrovani in December 2017 introduced as new <a href="director%20of%20football">director of football</a> of <a href="Persepolis%20F.C.">Persepolis</a>, being responsible for the club's major transfer market decisions.
